channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: AI Impact Summit clashes CBSE board exams: What to know if you are travelling in Delhi
Did Russia use a dart frog toxin to kill Alexei Navalny? How deadly is this poison?
Explained: The key takeaways from the Munich Security Conference
Hardly ate; wore bathrobes to class... How final days of Indian student found dead in US unfolded
Big tech honchos, 45 countries, AI discussions… Inside the India AI Impact summit in New Delhi
FirstUp: India AI Summit 2026 begins and other big news of the day
From vision to action: How India is leading the AI impact movement
item.description: The India AI Impact Summit 2026 will serve as a defining moment in global technology governance, representing the first major artificial intelligence summit hosted in the Global South

item.title: India-Bangladesh ties stand at a crossroads: Cautious optimism must translate into an enduring bond
item.description: Despite the tensions, structural interdependence endures in India-Bangladesh ties. Nearly 4,000 kilometres of shared border bind the two nations economically and culturally

item.title: Geopolitics has no free lunches: Pragmatism is Bangladesh’s only real option
item.description: New Delhi has clearly articulated its approach with a more robust Neighbourhood First policy, but the ball is in Dhaka’s court. Tarique Rahman must make the right choices to steer Bangladesh onto a development path

item.title: How China’s demographic debacle serves as a lesson for India
item.description: India’s choice to avoid coercion and respect women’s reproductive freedom not only preserves social stability but also leverages the natural benefits of an educated population

item.title: Exploring Bareilly: From Mahabharata legends to Ahichchhatra ruins
item.description: Bareilly was once the focal point of the kingdom of Uttara Panchala, one of the most significant places in the Mahabharat story. It was said to be ruled by Draupad, father of Draupadi, who was also called Panchali

item.title: When graffiti becomes history: Indian imprints in the land of Pharaohs and beyond
item.description: While ancient Indian graffiti in Egypt may be in the news right now, historical graffiti are not rare either in India or elsewhere in the world
